snippet.title: Best e-book readers
snippet.description: Looking for an e-book reader? You have more choices than ever before--though the number of models we

snippet.title: Kindle Paperwhite
snippet.description: With an excellent built-in light and Amazon's best-in-class e-book selection, the Kindle Paperwhite rises to the top of the e-reader pack.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire (2012)
snippet.description: The Kindle Fire (2012) takes it up a notch in value, but is tethered to the same design oversights of the original.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire
snippet.description: Though it lacks the tech specs found on more-expensive Apple and Android tablets, the $199 Kindle Fire is an outstanding entertainment value that prizes simplicity over techno-wizardry.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD (2013)
snippet.description: The 2013 Kindle Fire HD works perfectly as an e-reader with a few extra tablet features, but users looking to take full advantage of Amazon's ecosystem should pay more for the Fire HDX.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 7
snippet.description: Armed with a powerful processor and Amazon's exhaustive content library, the Kindle Fire HDX delivers incredible value for its price, especially for Amazon Prime members.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9
snippet.description: If you're looking for a pure media consumption experience, the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 delivers better than any tablet before it. People looking for something more utilitarian, however, will want to look elsewhere.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7in
snippet.description: With a beautiful screen, refined interface, and huge coffer of media consumption options, the Amazon Kindle Fire HD is the Kindle Fire as it should have been.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Touch 2011
snippet.description: The Kindle Touch is Amazon's best e-reader to date.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle (fall 2011)
snippet.description: If you don't want to spend the extra $20 to upgrade to the forthcoming touch-screen version, the entry-level 2011 Kindle is a great choice for an ultraportable and superaffordable no-frills e-ink reader.
